verses.roman:
namo vo vipra-patnībhyo
nibodhata vacāṁsi naḥ
ito 'vidūre caratā
kṛṣṇeneheṣitā vayam

synonyms: namaḥ—obeisances; vaḥ—unto you; vipra-patnībhyaḥ—the wives of the brāhmaṇas; vacāṁsi—words; naḥ—our; itaḥ—from here; avidūre—not distant; caratā—who is going; kṛṣṇena—by Lord Kṛṣṇa; iha—here; iṣitāḥ—sent; vayam—we.
translation: [The cowherd boys said:] Obeisances unto you, O wives of the learned brāhmaṇas. Kindly hear our words. We have been sent here by Lord Kṛṣṇa, who is passing by not far from here.
